scientists.name: Archimedes
scientists.Description: Archimedes was, arguably, the world’s greatest scientist – certainly the greatest scientist of the classical age.
achievements: invented the sciences of mechanics and hydrostatics
discovered the laws of levers and pulleys, which allow us to move heavy objects using small forces.
invented one of the most fundamental concepts of physics – the center of gravity.

scientists.name: Daniel Bernoulli
scientists.Description: Daniel Bernoulli published his masterpiece Hydrodynamica in 1738 only to see it plagiarized by his own jealous father.

scientists.name: Santiago Ramón y Cajal
scientists.Description: Santiago Ramón y Cajal is often called the father of neuroscience
achievements: Golgi/’s Method and Nerve Cells / Neurons

scientists.name: Subrahmanyan Chandrasekhar
scientists.Description: Subrahmanyan Chandrasekhar was an astrophysicist. He discovered that massive stars can collapse under their own gravity to reach enormous or even infinite densities. Today we call these collapsed stars neutron stars and black holes.
achievements: The Chandrasekhar Limit and the Fate of Stars
Stars end up losing their balance

scientists.name: Albert Einstein
scientists.Description: Albert Einstein rewrote the laws of nature. He completely changed the way we understand the behavior of things as basic as light, gravity, and time..
achievements: the equivalence of mass and energy

scientists.name: Benjamin Franklin
scientists.Description: Benjamin Franklin lived his life in the spirit of a renaissance man: he was deeply interested in the world around him, and he excelled in several widely differing fields of human endeavor.

scientists.name: Rosalind Franklin
scientists.Description: Rosalind Franklin’s X-ray work played a crucial role in the discovery of DNA’s structure.
achievements: Major Progress: Two Types of DNA

scientists.name: Galileo Galilei
scientists.Description: Galileo Galilei, most people simply call him Galileo, was one of the most significant people in the history of science. He lived at a crucial crossroads in time, when different strands of thought met and clashed
achievements: Tried to measure the speed of light, but found it was too fast for him to measure.
Was the first person ever to see the planet Neptune

scientists.name: William Harvey
scientists.Description: William Harvey was the first person to correctly describe blood’s circulation in the body.
achievements: Harvey donated money anonymously to allow the College of Physicians to build a new library.

scientists.name: Gene Shoemaker
scientists.Description: Gene Shoemaker was an astrogeologist. In fact, he was the very first astrogeologist.
achievements: Prediction of Life Arriving on Earth From Mars

scientists.name: B. F. Skinner
scientists.Description: B.F. Skinner was the 20th century’s most influential psychologist, pioneering the science of behaviorism.
